meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the endothelium.
meanings.sent1: The endothelial layer lines the blood vessels, helping to regulate blood flow.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the endothelial cells under the microscope to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The endothelial cells threw a party, inviting all the other cells to dance along the blood vessels.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness flowed through her like an endothelial river, touching everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The endothelial lining acted as a protective shield, guarding the blood vessels from harm.

meanings.definition: Comprising or consisting of endothelial cells.
meanings.sent1: The endothelial tissue formed a barrier between the blood and surrounding tissues.
meanings.sent2: The scientist discovered a new organ with an endothelial structure that amazed the medical community.
meanings.sent3: The endothelial cells in the body worked together like a team of tiny superheroes.
meanings.sent4: His words were like endothelial bricks, building a wall of understanding between them.
meanings.sent5: The endothelial composition of the organ ensured its proper function and health.
